comments:
cfgaperi.bat has the Derby JDBC drivers on the classpath, but not the DB2 drivers, so when you configure with DB2 it blows cookies as below.
I tried adding the drivers to the class, but ran into other class loading problems:

Next, the Aperi schema will be created.
Running "C:\Program Files\IBM\SQLLIB\BIN\db2cmd" /c scripts/db2config.bat administrator tpc6test Aperi Create 2500 -1 65537 1
000 10240 1024 40000 4096 10240 50 10000 150 8 16
----
----
Waiting 15 seconds for the configuration to be updated
DEBUG SDI calling analyzeParameters
